Competitions are often labeled as zero sum or positive sum.
Zero sum rivalry means that if one group achieves its goal, then the rival group cannot achieve
its own.
A good example of zero sum competition is when two nations struggle over the ownership
of an island.
In most cases, only one of them can physically control it at a time.
Positive sum means that more than one group can make progress towards fulfilling interests
or achieving goals at the same time.
For example, two nations may compete economically, but both may see their gross domestic product
increase simultaneously.
That's what I think we commonly refer to as a win-win situation.
Which I love, which I love.
I prefer.
We don't want to do zero sum.
We want to say, oh, I don't want to do something to Dave's divination.

win.
